info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:48PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lincoln, north central Sanders and west central Flathead Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 348 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 24 miles east of Noxon, or 28 miles southeast of Libby, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Happys Inn. This includes Highway 2 between mile markers 51 and 78. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northwestern Montana.
